scan_result.description: The result of the last scan on this file.  This string is usually one of: never_scanned, clean, quarantined, repaired, truncated, infected_no_action_taken, skipped_per_settings.  However, a longer string starting with 'unknown_status' and describing the details can also appear in uncommon edge cases.

scan_status.description: The scanning status of this file.  If 'current', the file was scanned with the most up-to-date virus definitions.  If 'not_current', it has either not been scanned, been modified since the last scan, or the virus definitions are not current.

has_quorum.description: If true, the local node is in a group with quorum: It is communicating, storing, and protecting data normally with other nodes in its group.  Under normal circumstances, every node in the cluster is part of one group.

is_compliance.description: If true, the cluster is in compliance mode.  Compliance mode clusters do not allow root access and have stricter WORM (Write Once Read Many) features for retaining data in compliance with U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rule 17a-4.

is_virtual.description: true if the cluster is deployed on a desktop VMWorkstation

is_vonefs.description: true if this is a vOneFS cluster on an ESXi

local_devid.description: Device ID of the queried node.

local_lnn.description: Device logical node number of the queried node.

local_serial.description: Device serial number of the queried node.

is_up.description: If true, this node is online and communicating with the local node and every other node with the is_up property normally.  If false, this node is not currently communicating with the local node or other nodes with the is_up property.  It may be shut down, rebooting, disconnected from the backend network, or connected only to other nodes.

lnn.description: Device logical node number.

type.description: Kernel release type.

batch_mode.description: This setting determines how notifications will be batched together to be sent by email.  'none' means each notification will be sent separately.  'severity' means notifications of the same severity will be sent together.  'category' means notifications of the same category will be sent together.  'all' means all notifications will be batched together and sent in a single email.

mail_relay.description: The address of the SMTP server to be used for relaying the notification messages.  An SMTP server is required in order to send notifications.  If this string is empty, no emails will be sent.

mail_sender.description: The full email address that will appear as the sender of notification messages.

mail_subject.description: The subject line for notification messages from this cluster.

smtp_auth_passwd.description: Password to authenticate with if SMTP authentication is being used.

smtp_auth_security.description: The type of secure communication protocol to use if SMTP is being used.  If 'none', plain text will be used, if 'starttls', the encrypted STARTTLS protocol will be used.

smtp_auth_username.description: Username to authenticate with if SMTP authentication is being used.

smtp_port.description: The port on the SMTP server to be used for relaying the notification messages.

use_smtp_auth.description: If true, this cluster will send SMTP authentication credentials to the SMTP relay server in order to send its notification emails.  If false, the cluster will attempt to send its notification emails without authentication.

user_template.description: Location of a custom template file that can be used to specify the layout of the notification emails.

allow_anon_access.description: Controls whether anonymous logins are permitted or not.

allow_anon_upload.description: Controls whether anonymous users will be permitted to upload files.

allow_dirlists.description: If set to false, all directory list commands will return a permission denied error.

allow_downloads.description: If set to false, all downloads requests will return a permission denied error.

allow_local_access.description: Controls whether local logins are permitted or not.

allow_writes.description: This controls whether any FTP commands which change the filesystem are allowed or not.

always_chdir_homedir.description: This controls whether FTP will always initially change directories to the home directory of the user, regardless of whether it is chroot-ing.

anon_chown_username.description: This is the name of the user who is given ownership of anonymously uploaded files.

anon_password_list.description: A list of passwords for anonymous users.

anon_root_path.description: This option represents a directory in /ifs which vsftpd will try to change into after an anonymous login.

anon_umask.description: The value that the umask for file creation is set to for anonymous users.

ascii_mode.description: Controls whether ascii mode data transfers are honored for various types of requests.

chroot_exception_list.description: A list of users that are not chrooted when logging in.

chroot_local_mode.description: If set to 'all', all local users will be (by default) placed in a chroot() jail in their home directory after login. If set to 'all-with-exceptions', all local users except those listed in the chroot exception list (isi ftp chroot-exception-list) will be placed in a chroot() jail in their home directory after login. If set to 'none', no local users will be chrooted by default. If set to 'none-with-exceptions', only the local users listed in the chroot exception list (isi ftp chroot-exception-list) will be place in a chroot() jail in their home directory after login.

connect_timeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, for a remote client to respond to our PORT style data connection.

data_timeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, which is roughly the maximum time we permit data transfers to stall for with no progress. If the timeout triggers, the remote client is kicked off.

denied_user_list.description: A list of uses that will be denied access.

dirlist_localtime.description: If enabled, display directory listings with the time in your local time zone. The default is to display GMT. The times returned by the MDTM FTP command are also affected by this option.

dirlist_names.description: When set to 'hide',  all user and group information in directory listings will be displayed as 'ftp'. When set to 'textual', textual names are shown in the user and group fields of directory listings. When set to 'numeric', numeric IDs are show in the user and group fields of directory listings.

file_create_perm.description: The permissions with which uploaded files are created. Umasks are applied on top of this value.

limit_anon_passwords.description: This field determines whether the anon_password_list is used.

local_root_path.description: This option represents a directory in /ifs which vsftpd will try to change into after a local login.

local_umask.description: The value that the umask for file creation is set to for local users.

service.description: This field controls whether the FTP daemon is running.

session_support.description: If enabled, maintain login sessions for each user through Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM). Disabling this option prevents the ability to do automatic home directory creation if that functionality were otherwise available.

session_timeout.description: The timeout, in seconds, which is roughly the maximum time we permit data transfers to stall for with no progress. If the timeout triggers, the remote client is kicked off.

user_config_dir.description: Specifies the directory where per-user config overrides can be found.

items.description: Specifies the properties for an ADS authentication provider.

allocate_gids.description: Allocates an ID for an unmapped Active Directory (ADS) group. ADS groups without GIDs can be proactively assigned a GID by the ID mapper. If the ID mapper option is disabled, GIDs are not proactively assigned, and when a primary group for a user does not include a GID, the system may allocate one.

allocate_uids.description: Allocates a user ID for an unmapped Active Directory (ADS) user. ADS users without UIDs can be proactively assigned a UID by the ID mapper. IF the ID mapper option is disabled, UIDs are not proactively assigned, and when an identify for a user does not include a UID, the system may allocate one.

assume_default_domain.description: Enables lookup of unqualified user names in the primary domain.

authentication.description: Enables authentication and identity management through the authentication provider.

check_online_interval.description: Specifies the time in seconds between provider online checks.

controller_time.description: Specifies the current time for the domain controllers.

create_home_directory.description: Automatically creates a home directory on the first login.

domain_offline_alerts.description: Sends an alert if the domain goes offline.

extra_expected_spns.description: List of additional SPNs to expect beyond what automatic checking routines might find

findable_groups.description: Sets list of groups that can be resolved.

findable_users.description: Sets list of users that can be resolved.

home_directory_template.description: Specifies the path to the home directory template.

hostname.description: Specifies the fully qualified hostname stored in the machine account.

id.description: Specifies the ID of the Active Directory provider instance.

ignore_all_trusts.description: If set to true, ignores all trusted domains.

ignored_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to false.

include_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to true.

ldap_sign_and_seal.description: Enables encryption and signing on LDAP requests.

lookup_domains.description: Limits user and group lookups to the specified domains.

lookup_groups.description: Looks up AD groups in other providers before allocating a group ID.

lookup_normalize_groups.description: Normalizes AD group names to lowercase before look up.

lookup_normalize_users.description: Normalize AD user names to lowercase before look up.

lookup_users.description: Looks up AD users in other providers before allocating a user ID.

machine_account.description: Specifies the machine account name when creating a SAM account with Active Directory.

machine_password_changes.description: Enables periodic changes of the machine password for security.

machine_password_lifespan.description: Sets maximum age of a password in seconds.

name.description: Specifies the Active Directory provider name.

netbios_domain.description: Specifies the NetBIOS domain name associated with the machine account.

node_dc_affinity.description: Specifies the domain controller for which the node has affinity.

restrict_findable.description: Check the provider for filtered lists of findable and unfindable users and groups.

extra_expected_spns.description: List of additional SPNs to expect beyond what automatic checking routines might find

findable_groups.description: Sets list of groups that can be resolved.

findable_users.description: Sets list of users that can be resolved.

home_directory_template.description: Specifies the path to the home directory template.

ignore_all_trusts.description: If set to true, ignores all trusted domains.

ignored_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to false.

include_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to true.

ldap_sign_and_seal.description: Enables encryption and signing on LDAP requests.

lookup_domains.description: Limits user and group lookups to the specified domains.

lookup_groups.description: Looks up AD groups in other providers before allocating a group ID.

lookup_normalize_groups.description: Normalizes AD group names to lowercase before look up.

lookup_normalize_users.description: Normalize AD user names to lowercase before look up.

lookup_users.description: Looks up AD users in other providers before allocating a user ID.

machine_password_changes.description: Enables periodic changes of the machine password for security.

machine_password_lifespan.description: Sets maximum age of a password in seconds.

node_dc_affinity.description: Specifies the domain controller for which the node has affinity.

node_dc_affinity_timeout.description: Specifies the timeout for the domain controller for which the local node has affinity.

nss_enumeration.description: Enables the Active Directory provider to respond to 'getpwent' and 'getgrent' requests.

password.description: Specifies the password used during domain join.

reset_schannel.description: Resets the secure channel to the primary domain.

restrict_findable.description: Check the provider for filtered lists of findable and unfindable users and groups.

sfu_support.description: Specifies whether to support RFC 2307 attributes on ADS domain controllers.

store_sfu_mappings.description: Stores SFU mappings permanently in the ID mapper.

unfindable_groups.description: Specifies groups that cannot be resolved by the provider.

unfindable_users.description: Specifies users that cannot be resolved by the provider.

user.description: Specifies the user name that has permission to join a machine to the given domain.

ProvidersAdsItem.description: Specifies the properties for an ADS authentication provider.

allocate_gids.description: Allocates an ID for an unmapped Active Directory (ADS) group. ADS groups without GIDs can be proactively assigned a GID by the ID mapper. If the ID mapper option is disabled, GIDs are not proactively assigned, and when a primary group for a user does not include a GID, the system may allocate one.

allocate_uids.description: Allocates a user ID for an unmapped Active Directory (ADS) user. ADS users without UIDs can be proactively assigned a UID by the ID mapper. IF the ID mapper option is disabled, UIDs are not proactively assigned, and when an identify for a user does not include a UID, the system may allocate one.

assume_default_domain.description: Enables lookup of unqualified user names in the primary domain.

authentication.description: Enables authentication and identity management through the authentication provider.

check_online_interval.description: Specifies the time in seconds between provider online checks.

controller_time.description: Specifies the current time for the domain controllers.

create_home_directory.description: Automatically creates a home directory on the first login.

dns_domain.description: Specifies the DNS search domain. Set this parameter if the DNS search domain has a unique name or address.

domain_offline_alerts.description: Sends an alert if the domain goes offline.

extra_expected_spns.description: List of additional SPNs to expect beyond what automatic checking routines might find

ignored_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to false.

include_trusted_domains.description: Includes trusted domains when 'ignore_all_trusts' is set to true.

name.description: Specifies the Active Directory provider name.

settings.description: Specifies the properties for the Duo provider.

ProvidersDuoExtended.description: Specifies the properties for the Duo provider.

autopush.description: Specifies if Duo automatically sends a push login request to the users phone.

enabled.description: Specifies if the Duo provider is enabled.

failmode.description: Specifies if Duo will fail "safe" (allow access) or "secure" (deny access) on configuration or service errors.

fallback_local_ip.description: Specifies if Duo will report the server IP if the client IP cannot be detected.

groups.description: Specifies a list of groups Duo is required for (default is all groups).

http_proxy.description: Specifies the HTTP proxy to use.

https_timeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait for HTTPS responses from Duo Security.

prompts.description: Specifies the maximum number of authentication prompts to display (1-3 default is 3).

pushinfo.description: Specifies to include information in the Duo Push message.

enumerate_groups.description: If true, allows the provider to enumerate groups.

enumerate_users.description: If true, allows the provider to enumerate users.

findable_groups.description: Specifies the list of groups that can be resolved.

findable_users.description: Specifies the list of users that can be resolved.

group_base_dn.description: Specifies the distinguished name of the entry where LDAP searches for groups are started.

group_domain.description: Specifies the domain for this provider through which groups are qualified.

group_filter.description: Specifies the LDAP filter for group objects.

group_members_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Group Members attribute.

group_search_scope.description: Specifies the depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

home_directory_template.description: Specifies the path to the home directory template.

ignore_tls_errors.description: If true, continues over secure connections even if identity checks fail.

listable_groups.description: Specifies the groups that can be viewed in the provider.

listable_users.description: Specifies the users that can be viewed in the provider.

member_lookup_method.description: Sets the method by which group member lookups are performed. Use caution when changing this option directly.

member_of_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Query Member Of attribute, which performs reverse membership queries.

name.description: Specifies the name of the LDAP provider.

name_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP UID attribute, which is used as the login name.

netgroup_filter.description: Specifies the LDAP filter for netgroup objects.

netgroup_members_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Netgroup Members attribute.

netgroup_search_scope.description: Specifies the depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

netgroup_triple_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Netgroup Triple attribute.

normalize_groups.description: Normalizes group names to lowercase before look up.

normalize_users.description: Normalizes user names to lowercase before look up.

nt_password_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP NT Password attribute.

ntlm_support.description: Specifies which NTLM versions to support for users with NTLM-compatible credentials.

require_secure_connection.description: Determines whether to continue over a non-TLS connection.

restrict_findable.description: If true, checks the provider for filtered lists of findable and unfindable users and groups.

restrict_listable.description: If true, checks the provider for filtered lists of listable and unlistable users and groups.

search_scope.description: Specifies the default depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

search_timeout.description: Specifies the search timeout period in seconds.

shadow_expire_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the absolute date to expire the account.

shadow_flag_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the section of the shadow map that is used to store the flag value.

shadow_inactive_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the number of days of inactivity that is allowed for the user.

shadow_last_change_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the last change of the shadow information.

shadow_max_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the maximum number of days a password can be valid.

shadow_min_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the minimum number of days between shadow changes.

shadow_user_filter.description: Sets LDAP filter for shadow user objects.

shadow_warning_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the number of days before the password expires to warn the user.

ssh_public_key_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the SSH Public Key for the user.

template.description: Specifies template to be used to create the LDAP provider. The list of templates can be found at /auth/ldap-templates.  Any fields directly defined in your request will override the template values.

tls_protocol_min.description: Specifies the minimum TLS protocol version.

uid_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP UID Number attribute.

unfindable_users.description: Specifies users that cannot be resolved by the provider.

unique_group_members_attribute.description: Sets the LDAP Unique Group Members attribute.

user_search_scope.description: Specifies the depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

id.description: Specifies the ID of the LDAP provider.

ignore_tls_errors.description: If true, continues over secure connections even if identity checks fail.

listable_groups.description: Specifies the groups that can be viewed in the provider.

listable_users.description: Specifies the users that can be viewed in the provider.

member_lookup_method.description: Sets the method by which group member lookups are performed. Use caution when changing this option directly.

member_of_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Query Member Of attribute, which performs reverse membership queries.

name.description: Specifies the name of the LDAP provider.

name_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP UID attribute, which is used as the login name.

netgroup_base_dn.description: Specifies the distinguished name of the entry where LDAP searches for netgroups are started.

netgroup_filter.description: Specifies the LDAP filter for netgroup objects.

netgroup_members_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Netgroup Members attribute.

netgroup_search_scope.description: Specifies the depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

netgroup_triple_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP Netgroup Triple attribute.

normalize_groups.description: Normalizes group names to lowercase before look up.

normalize_users.description: Normalizes user names to lowercase before look up.

nt_password_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP NT Password attribute.

ntlm_support.description: Specifies which NTLM versions to support for users with NTLM-compatible credentials.

require_secure_connection.description: Determines whether to continue over a non-TLS connection.

restrict_findable.description: If true, checks the provider for filtered lists of findable and unfindable users and groups.

restrict_listable.description: If true, checks the provider for filtered lists of listable and unlistable users and groups.

search_scope.description: Specifies the default depth from the base DN to perform LDAP searches.

search_timeout.description: Specifies the search timeout period in seconds.

shadow_expire_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the absolute date to expire the account.

shadow_flag_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the section of the shadow map that is used to store the flag value.

shadow_inactive_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the number of days of inactivity that is allowed for the user.

shadow_last_change_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the last change of the shadow information.

shadow_max_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the maximum number of days a password can be valid.

shadow_min_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the minimum number of days between shadow changes.

shadow_user_filter.description: Sets LDAP filter for shadow user objects.

shadow_warning_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the number of days before the password expires to warn the user.

ssh_public_key_attribute.description: Sets the attribute name that indicates the SSH Public Key for the user.

tls_protocol_min.description: Specifies the minimum TLS protocol version.

uid_attribute.description: Specifies the LDAP UID Number attribute.

unfindable_users.description: Specifies users that cannot be resolved by the provider.

id.description: The system ID given to the quota.

notifications.description: Summary of notifications: 'custom' indicates one or more notification rules available from the notifications sub-resource; 'default' indicates system default rules are used; 'disabled' indicates that no notifications will be used for this quota.; 'badmap' indicates that notification rule has problem in rule map.

persona.description: Specifies properties for a persona, which consists of either a 'type' and a 'name' or an 'ID'.

ready.description: True if the default resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

thresholds_on.description: Thresholds apply on quota accounting metric.

type.description: The type of quota.

advisory.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent but writes will not be denied.

hard.description: Usage bytes at which further writes will be denied.

percent_advisory.description: Advisory threshold as percent of hard threshold.

percent_soft.description: Soft threshold as percent of hard threshold.

soft.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent and soft grace time will be started.

soft_grace.description: Time in seconds after which the soft threshold has been hit before writes will be denied.

advisory.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent but writes will not be denied.

advisory_exceeded.description: True if the advisory threshold has been hit.

advisory_last_exceeded.description: Time at which advisory threshold was hit.

hard.description: Usage bytes at which further writes will be denied.

hard_exceeded.description: True if the hard threshold has been hit.

hard_last_exceeded.description: Time at which hard threshold was hit.

percent_advisory.description: Advisory threshold as percent of hard threshold. Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent but writes will not be denied.

percent_soft.description: Soft threshold as percent of hard threshold. Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent and soft grace time will be started.

soft.description: Usage bytes at which notifications will be sent and soft grace time will be started.

soft_exceeded.description: True if the soft threshold has been hit.

soft_grace.description: Time in seconds after which the soft threshold has been hit before writes will be denied.

soft_last_exceeded.description: Time at which soft threshold was hit

applogical.description: Bytes used by governed data apparent to application.

fslogical.description: Bytes used by governed data apparent to filesystem.

fslogical_ready.description: True if fslogical resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

fsphysical.description: Physical data usage adjusted to account for shadow store efficiency

fsphysical_ready.description: True if fsphysical resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

inodes.description: Number of inodes (filesystem entities) used by governed data.

inodes_ready.description: True if inodes resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

physical.description: Bytes used for governed data and filesystem overhead.

physical_ready.description: True if physical resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

shadow_refs.description: Number of shadow references (cloned, deduplicated or packed filesystem blocks) used by governed data.

shadow_refs_ready.description: True if shadow_refs resource accounting is accurate on the quota. If false, this quota is waiting on completion of a QuotaScan job.

ServicePolicy.description: Specifies the properties of a policy.

accelerated_failback.description: If set to true, SyncIQ will perform failback configuration tasks during the next job run, rather than waiting to perform those tasks during the failback process. Performing these tasks ahead of time will increase the speed of failback operations.

bandwidth_reservation.description: The desired bandwidth reservation for this policy in kb/s. This feature will not activate unless a SyncIQ bandwidth rule is in effect.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_quota_tmp_dir.description: If set to true, SyncIQ will not create temporary quota directories to aid in replication to target paths which contain quotas.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

encryption_cipher_list.description: The cipher list being used with encryption. For SyncIQ targets, this list serves as a list of supported ciphers. For SyncIQ sources, the list of ciphers will be attempted to be used in order.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.  If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

linked_data_policies.description: A list of SyncIQ policy names/IDs whose source root directories will be used to filter service replication.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

ocsp_address.description: The address of the OCSP responder to which to connect.

ocsp_issuer_certificate_id.description: The ID of the certificate authority that issued the certificate whose revocation status is being checked.

password.description: The password for the target cluster.  This field is not readable.

priority.description: Determines the priority level of a policy. Policies with higher priority will have precedence to run over lower priority policies. Valid range is [0, 1]. Default is 0.

replicated_services.description: A list of services to replicate.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

rpo_alert.description: If --schedule is set to a time/date, an alert is created if the specified RPO for this policy is exceeded. The default value is 0, which will not generate RPO alerts.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

service_history_max_age.description: Maximum age of service information to maintain, in seconds.

service_history_max_count.description: Maximum number of historical service information records to maintain.

skip_lookup.description: Skip DNS lookup of target IPs.

snapshot_sync_existing.description: If true, snapshot-triggered syncs will include snapshots taken before policy creation time (requires --schedule when-snapshot-taken).

snapshot_sync_pattern.description: The naming pattern that a snapshot must match to trigger a sync when the schedule is when-snapshot-taken (default is "*").

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

source_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the source cluster.

source_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the source cluster before a sync.

target_certificate_id.description: The ID of the target cluster certificate being used for encryption.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_snapshot_alias.description: The alias of the snapshot taken on the target cluster after the sync completes. A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

target_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the target cluster.

target_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the target cluster after the sync completes.  A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

workers_per_node.description: The number of worker threads on a node performing a sync.

global_settings.description: Specifies the properties for global authentication settings.

alloc_retries.description: Specifies the number of times to retry an ID allocation before failing.

gid_range_enabled.description: If true, allocates GIDs from a fixed range.

gid_range_max.description: Specifies the ending number for a fixed range from which GIDs are allocated.

gid_range_min.description: Specifies the starting number for a fixed range from which GIDs are allocated.

gid_range_next.description: Specifies the next GID to allocate.

group_uid.description: Specifies the user iD for a group when requested by the kernel.

load_providers.description: Specifies which providers are loaded by the authentication daemon (lsassd).

min_mapped_rid.description: Starts the RID in the local domain to map a UID and a GID.

on_disk_identity.description: Specifies the type of identity that is stored on disk.

rpc_block_time.description: Specifies the minimum amount of time in milliseconds to wait before performing an oprestart.

rpc_max_requests.description: Specifies the maximum number of outstanding RPC requests.

rpc_timeout.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time in seconds to wait for an idmap response.

system_gid_threshold.description: Specifies the minimum GID to attempt to look up in the idmap database.

uid_range_enabled.description: If true, allocates UIDs from a fixed range.

unknown_gid.description: Specifies the GID for the unknown (anonymous) group.

unknown_uid.description: Specifies the UID for the unknown (anonymous) user.

user_object_cache_size.description: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of the security object cache in the authentication daemon.

workgroup.description: Specifies the NetBIOS workgroup or domain.

audited_zones.description: Specifies zones that are audited when the protocol_auditing_enabled property is enabled.

alias.description: Alias name to create for this snapshot. If null, remove any alias.

expires.description: The Unix Epoch time the snapshot will expire and be eligible for automatic deletion.

name.description: The user or system supplied snapshot name. This will be null for snapshots pending delete.

created.description: The Unix Epoch time the snapshot was created.

has_locks.description: True if the snapshot has one or more locks present see, see the locks subresource of a snapshot for a list of locks.

id.description: The system ID given to the snapshot. This is useful for tracking the status of delete pending snapshots.

pct_filesystem.description: Percentage of /ifs used for storing this snapshot.

pct_reserve.description: Percentage of configured snapshot reserved used for storing this snapshot.

schedule.description: The name of the schedule used to create this snapshot, if applicable.

shadow_bytes.description: The amount of shadow bytes referred to by this snapshot.

size.description: The amount of storage in bytes used to store this snapshot.

target_id.description: The ID of the snapshot pointed to if this is an alias. 18446744073709551615 (max uint64) is returned for an alias to the live filesystem.

target_name.description: The name of the snapshot pointed to if this is an alias.

active_size.description: Sum of sizes of active snapshots.

deleting_size.description: Sum of sizes of delete-pending snapshots.

size.description: Sum of sizes in bytes of all snapshots.

read_only_community.description: The read-only community name.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

service.description: Whether the SNMP service is enabled.

snmp_v1_v2c_access.description: Whether SNMP v1 and v2c protocols are enabled.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_access.description: Whether SNMP v3 is enabled.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_auth_protocol.description: SNMPv3 authentication protocol. May only be SHA or MD5.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_password.description: This field allows a client to change the SNMP v3 authentication password. There is always a password set.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_priv_password.description: This field allows a client to change the SNMP v3 privacy password. There is always a password set.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_priv_protocol.description: SNMPv3 privacy protocol. May only be AES or DES. @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_read_only_user.description: The read-only user for SNMP v3 read requests.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

snmp_v3_security_level.description: SNMPv3 privacy protocol. May only be AES or DES. @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

system_contact.description: Contact information for the system owner.  This must be a valid email address.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

system_location.description: A location name for the SNMP system.  @DEFAULT reverts this field to its default value.

settings.description: Specifies the properties for SSH authentication settings.

max_auth_tries.description: Specifies the maximum number of authentication attempts per connection.

max_startups.description: Specifies maximum number of unauthenticated connections.

password_authentication.description: Specifies whether password authentication is allowed.

permit_empty_passwords.description: Enable empty passwords if password authentication is allowed.

port.description: Specifies the port sshd(8) should listen on

print_motd.description: Enable printing /etc/motd when a user logs in.

strict_modes.description: Specifies if sshd(8) should check home directory permissions before accepting login.

syslog_facility.description: Specifies the facility code when logging messages from sshd(8).

tcp_keep_alive.description: Enable sending TCP keep alive messages.

use_dns.description: Specifies whether sshd should look up the remote host name.

use_pam.description: Enables the Pluggable Authentication Module interface.

source_directories_linked.description: The number of directories linked on the source.

source_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the source.

source_directories_visited.description: The number of directories visited on the source.

source_files_deleted.description: The number of files deleted on the source.

source_files_linked.description: The number of files linked on the source.

source_files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked on the source.

sparse_data_bytes.description: The number of sparse data bytes transferred by this job.

start_time.description: The time the job started in unix epoch seconds. The field is null if the job hasn't started.

succeeded_chunks.description: The number of data chunks that have been transmitted successfully.

symlinks_replicated.description: The number of symlinks replicated by this job.

sync_type.description: The type of sync being performed by this job.

target_bytes_recovered.description: The number of bytes recovered on the target.

target_directories_created.description: The number of directories created on the target.

target_directories_deleted.description: The number of directories deleted on the target.

target_directories_linked.description: The number of directories linked on the target.

target_directories_unlinked.description: The number of directories unlinked on the target.

target_files_deleted.description: The number of files deleted on the target.

target_files_linked.description: The number of files linked on the target.

target_files_unlinked.description: The number of files unlinked on the target.

target_snapshots.description: The target snapshots created by this job.

total_chunks.description: The total number of data chunks transmitted by this job.

total_data_bytes.description: The total number of bytes transferred by this job.

total_exported_services.description: The total number of components exported as part of service replication.

total_files.description: The number of files affected by this job.

total_network_bytes.description: The total number of bytes sent over the network by this job.

total_phases.description: The total number of phases for this job.

unchanged_data_bytes.description: The number of bytes unchanged by this job.

up_to_date_files_skipped.description: The number of up-to-date files skipped by this job.

updated_files_replicated.description: The number of updated files replicated by this job.

user_conflict_files_skipped.description: The number of files with user conflicts skipped by this job.

warnings.description: A list of warning messages for this job.

workers.description: A list of workers for this job.

worm_committed_file_conflicts.description: The number of WORM committed files which needed to be reverted. Since WORM committed files cannot be reverted, this is the number of files that were preserved in the compliance store.

end_time.description: The time the job ended this phase.

phase.description: The phase that the job was in.

start_time.description: The time the job began this phase.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

or_criteria.description: An array containing objects with "and_criteria" properties, each set of and_criteria will be logically OR'ed together to create the full file matching pattern.

and_criteria.description: An array containing individual file criterion objects each describing one criterion.  These are logically AND'ed together to form a set of criteria.

items.description: An object describing one criterion for finding a matching file, for example "size is greater than or equal to 10KB". Note: For time types (accessed_*, birth_*, and changed_*), operator is not required (it is implicitly ==).  For the value, you can use a relative date and time, such as "two weeks ago", or specific date and time, such as "January 1, 2012."  Time settings are based on a 24-hour clock.

attribute_exists.description: For "custom_attribute" type criteria.  The file will match as long as the attribute named by "field" exists.  Default is true.

case_sensitive.description: If true, the value comparison will be case sensitive.  Default is true.

field.description: The name of the file attribute to match on (only required if this is a custom_attribute type criterion).  Default is an empty string "".

operator.description: How to compare the specified attribute of each file to the specified value.

type.description: The type of this criterion, that is, which file attribute to match on.

value.description: The value to compare the specified attribute of each file to.

whole_word.description: If true, the attribute must match the entire word.  Default is true.

directory.description: The directory of the service export.

end_time.description: The time the job ended this component.

error_msg.description: A list of error messages generated while exporting components.

filter.description: A list of path-based filters for exporting components.

handlers_failed.description: The number of handlers failed during export.

handlers_skipped.description: The number of handlers skipped during export.

records_failed.description: The number of records failed during export.

records_skipped.description: The number of records skipped during export.

start_time.description: The time the job began this component.

status.description: The current status of export for this component.

connected.description: Whether there is a connection between the source and target.

last_split.description: The last time a network split occurred.

last_work.description: The last time the worker performed work.

lnn.description: The lnn the worker is assigned to run on.

process_id.description: The process ID of the worker.

source_host.description: The source host for this worker.

target_host.description: The target host for this worker.

resume.description: Provide this token as the 'resume' query argument to continue listing results.

items.description: Specifies the properties of a policy.
Specifies the properties of a policy.

resume.description: Provide this token as the 'resume' query argument to continue listing results.

SyncPolicy.description: Specifies the properties of a policy.

accelerated_failback.description: If set to true, SyncIQ will perform failback configuration tasks during the next job run, rather than waiting to perform those tasks during the failback process. Performing these tasks ahead of time will increase the speed of failback operations.

action.description: If 'copy', source files will be copied to the target cluster.  If 'sync', the target directory will be made an image of the source directory:  Files and directories that have been deleted on the source, have been moved within the target directory, or no longer match the selection criteria will be deleted from the target directory.

bandwidth_reservation.description: The desired bandwidth reservation for this policy in kb/s. This feature will not activate unless a SyncIQ bandwidth rule is in effect.

changelist.description: If true, retain previous source snapshot and incremental repstate, both of which are required for changelist creation.

check_integrity.description: If true, the sync target performs cyclic redundancy checks (CRC) on the data as it is received.

cloud_deep_copy.description: If set to deny, replicates all CloudPools smartlinks to the target cluster as smartlinks; if the target cluster does not support the smartlinks, the job will fail. If set to force, replicates all smartlinks to the target cluster as regular files. If set to allow, SyncIQ will attempt to replicate smartlinks to the target cluster as smartlinks; if the target cluster does not support the smartlinks, SyncIQ will replicate the smartlinks as regular files.

conflicted.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  If true, the most recent run of this policy encountered an error and this policy will not start any more scheduled jobs until this field is manually set back to 'false'.

delete_quotas.description: If true, forcibly remove quotas on the target after they have been removed on the source.

description.description: User-assigned description of this sync policy.

disable_file_split.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  If true, the 7.2+ file splitting capability will be disabled.

disable_fofb.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Enable/disable sync failover/failback.

disable_quota_tmp_dir.description: If set to true, SyncIQ will not create temporary quota directories to aid in replication to target paths which contain quotas.

disable_stf.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Enable/disable the 6.5+ STF based data transfer and uses only treewalk.

enable_hash_tmpdir.description: If true, syncs will use temporary working directory subdirectories to reduce lock contention.

enabled.description: If true, jobs will be automatically run based on this policy, according to its schedule.

encryption_cipher_list.description: The cipher list being used with encryption. For SyncIQ targets, this list serves as a list of supported ciphers. For SyncIQ sources, the list of ciphers will be attempted to be used in order.

expected_dataloss.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Continue sending files even with the corrupted filesystem.

file_matching_pattern.description: A file matching pattern, organized as an OR'ed set of AND'ed file criteria, for example ((a AND b) OR (x AND y)) used to define a set of files with specific properties.  Policies of type 'sync' cannot use 'path' or time criteria in their matching patterns, but policies of type 'copy' can use all listed criteria.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.  If you enable this option, the net.inet.ip.choose_ifa_by_ipsrc sysctl should be set.

job_delay.description: If --schedule is set to When-Source-Modified, the duration to wait after a modification is made before starting a job (default is 0 seconds).

linked_service_policies.description: A list of service replication policies that this data replication policy will be associated with.

log_level.description: Severity an event must reach before it is logged.

log_removed_files.description: If true, the system will log any files or directories that are deleted due to a sync.

name.description: User-assigned name of this sync policy.

ocsp_address.description: The address of the OCSP responder to which to connect.

ocsp_issuer_certificate_id.description: The ID of the certificate authority that issued the certificate whose revocation status is being checked.

password.description: The password for the target cluster.  This field is not readable.

priority.description: Determines the priority level of a policy. Policies with higher priority will have precedence to run over lower priority policies. Valid range is [0, 1]. Default is 0.

report_max_age.description: Length of time (in seconds) a policy report will be stored.

report_max_count.description: Maximum number of policy reports that will be stored on the system.

restrict_target_network.description: If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

rpo_alert.description: If --schedule is set to a time/date, an alert is created if the specified RPO for this policy is exceeded. The default value is 0, which will not generate RPO alerts.

schedule.description: The schedule on which new jobs will be run for this policy.

service_policy.description: If true, this is a service replication policy.

skip_lookup.description: Skip DNS lookup of target IPs.

skip_when_source_unmodified.description: If true and --schedule is set to a time/date, the policy will not run if no changes have been made to the contents of the source directory since the last job successfully completed.

snapshot_sync_existing.description: If true, snapshot-triggered syncs will include snapshots taken before policy creation time (requires --schedule when-snapshot-taken).

snapshot_sync_pattern.description: The naming pattern that a snapshot must match to trigger a sync when the schedule is when-snapshot-taken (default is "*").

source_exclude_directories.description: Directories that will be excluded from the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_include_directories.description: Directories that will be included in the sync.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_network.description: Restricts replication policies on the local cluster to running on the specified subnet and pool.

source_root_path.description: The root directory on the source cluster the files will be synced from.  Modifying this field will result in a full synchronization of all data.

source_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the source data will be taken on the source cluster before a sync.

source_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the source cluster.

source_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the source cluster before a sync.

target_certificate_id.description: The ID of the target cluster certificate being used for encryption.

target_compare_initial_sync.description: If true, the target creates diffs against the original sync.

target_detect_modifications.description: If true, target cluster will detect if files have been changed on the target by legacy tree walk syncs.

target_host.description: Hostname or IP address of sync target cluster.  Modifying the target cluster host can result in the policy being unrunnable if the new target does not match the current target association.

target_path.description: Absolute filesystem path on the target cluster for the sync destination.

target_snapshot_alias.description: The alias of the snapshot taken on the target cluster after the sync completes. A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

target_snapshot_archive.description: If true, archival snapshots of the target data will be taken on the target cluster after successful sync completions.

target_snapshot_expiration.description: The length of time in seconds to keep snapshots on the target cluster.

target_snapshot_pattern.description: The name pattern for snapshots taken on the target cluster after the sync completes.  A value of @DEFAULT will reset this field to the default creation value.

workers_per_node.description: The number of worker threads on a node performing a sync.

force_interface.description: NOTE: This field should not be changed without the help of PowerScale support.  Default for the "force_interface" property that will be applied to each new sync policy unless otherwise specified at the time of policy creation.  Determines whether data is sent only through the subnet and pool specified in the "source_network" field. This option can be useful if there are multiple interfaces for the given source subnet.

If you specify true, and you specify a SmartConnect zone in the "target_host" field, replication policies will connect only to nodes in the specified SmartConnect zone.  If you specify false, replication policies are not restricted to specific nodes on the target cluster.

cluster_overview.description: The cluster overview of an upgrade process.

cluster_state.description: The different states of an upgrade, rollback, or assessment. One of the following values: 'committed', 'upgraded', 'partially upgraded', 'upgrading', 'rolling back', 'assessing', 'error'

committed_features.description: The feature set supported as of the most recent upgrade commit.

finish_time.description: The time when a rollback, assessment or upgrade has finished completely. Use ISO 8601 standard. Null if the cluster_state is not 'upgraded'.

install_image_path.description: The location (path) of the upgrade image which must be within /ifs. Null if the cluster_state is 'committed' or 'upgraded.'

node_median_time.description: The median time (seconds) to complete each node so far during this upgrade. Before the first node in an upgrade has completed this key will have an associated null value.

onefs_version_current.description: The current OneFS version before upgrade.

onefs_version_upgrade.description: The OneFS version the user is attempting to upgrade to. Null if the cluster_state is 'committed' or 'assessing.'

patch_action.description: The most recent patch action performed.

patch_name.description: The patch with the most recent patch action.

start_time.description: The time when an upgrade, rollback, or assessment was started. Use ISO 8601 standard. Null if the cluster_state is 'committed' or 'partially upgraded.'

upgrade_process_state.description: The different states of upgrade process. One of the following values: 'Not started', 'Running', 'Pausing', 'Paused'.

upgrade_settings.description: The settings necessary when starting an upgrade. Null if the cluster_state is not 'upgrading' or 'partially upgraded.' or 'error'.

upgrade_triggered_time.description: Time at which upgrade was originally requested.

nodes_current.description: Number of nodes running the current OneFS version.

nodes_total.description: Total number of nodes on the cluster.

nodes_transitioning.description: Number of nodes transitioning between OneFS versions. Null if the cluster_state is 'committed' or 'assessing.'

nodes_upgraded.description: Number of nodes running the upgraded OneFS version. Null if the cluster_state is 'committed' or 'assessing.'

UpgradeClusterFirmwareDevice.description: The firmware status for the cluster.

nodes.description: List of the firmware status information for all the nodes in the cluster.

items.description: The firmware status for the node.

devices.description: List of the firmware status for hardware components on the node.

items.description: The firmware status for a hardware component on the node.

lnn.description: The lnn of the node.

package.description: List of the firmware binary information for the installed firmware package.

items.description: The firmware binary information.

mismatch.description: Is the firmware up-to-date for this component.

type.description: The device type.

upgrade_status.description: The current state of the firmware upgrade for this component. One of the following values: 'queued', 'upgrading', 'upgraded', 'error' or 'null'.'null' indicates that the upgrade status is unknown.

checksum.description: Valid checksum string for binary. One of the following: 'ok', 'bad', 'file_missing', or 'na'

firmware.description: The name of the firmware binary.

version.description: The version string for the binary.

nodes_to_rolling_upgrade.description: The nodes (to be) scheduled for upgrade ordered by queue position number. Null if the cluster_state is 'partially upgraded' or upgrade_type is 'simultaneous'. One of the following values: [<lnn-1>, <lnn-2>, ... ], 'all', null

items.description: The lnn of the node.

upgrade_type.description: The type of upgrade to perform. One of the following values: 'rolling', 'simultaneous'

items.description: Specifies properties for a persona, which consists of either a 'type' and a 'name' or an 'ID'.

commit_to_worm.description: Specifies whether to commit the file to a WORM state after the retention date is set.

worm_retention_date.description: Specifies the retention expiration date string in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC/GMT).

autocommit_offset.description: Specifies the autocommit time period for the domain in seconds.  After a file is in the domain without being modified for the specified time period, the file is automatically committed. If this parameter is set to null, there is no autocommit time, and files must be committed manually.

exclusions.description: A list of directories excluded from WORM protection. In a POST/PUT request this collection specifies the directories that the user wishes to create SmartLock exclusion directories on underneath this SmartLock directory. In a GET request this collection specifies all of the exclusion directories that exist underneath this SmartLock directory.

override_date.description: Specifies the override retention date for the domain. If this date is later than the retention date for any committed file, the file will remain protected until the override retention date.

privileged_delete.description: When this value is set to 'on', files in this domain can be deleted through the privileged delete feature. If this value is set to 'disabled', privileged file deletes are permanently disabled and cannot be turned on again.

set_pending_delete.description: If true, the domain is irreversibly marked for deletion. This is used for compliance domains and allows compliance store directories to be deleted, while disallowing the creation or committing of new/existing files.

type.description: Specifies whether the domain is an enterprise domain or a compliance domain. Compliance domains can not be created on enterprise clusters. Enterprise and compliance domains can be created on compliance clusters.

path.description: Specifies the root path of this domain. Files in this directory and all sub-directories will be protected.

id.description: Specifies the system-assigned ID for the WORM exclusion domain.

lin.description: Specifies the logical inode number (LIN) for the root of this domain.

path.description: Specifies the root path of this domain. Files in this directory and all sub-directories will not be protected.

exclusions.description: A list of directories excluded from WORM protection. In a POST/PUT request this collection specifies the directories that the user wishes to create SmartLock exclusion directories on underneath this SmartLock directory. In a GET request this collection specifies all of the exclusion directories that exist underneath this SmartLock directory.

id.description: Specifies the system-assigned ID for the protection domain.

incomplete.description: True if OneFS is still in the process of creating this domain and is unable to prevent files from being modified or deleted. If false, indicates that the domain is fully created and is able to prevent files from being modified or deleted.

lin.description: Specifies the logical inode number (LIN) for the root of this domain.

max_modifies.description: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a file in this domain will be protected. This setting will override the retention period of any file committed with a longer retention period. If this parameter is set to null, an infinite length retention period is set.

path.description: Specifies the root path of this domain. Files in this directory and all sub-directories will be protected.

privileged_delete.description: When this value is set to 'on', files in this domain can be deleted through the privileged delete feature. If this value is set to 'disabled', privileged file deletes are permanently disabled and cannot be turned on again.

set_pending_delete.description: If true, the domain is irreversibly marked for deletion. This is used for compliance domains and allows compliance store directories to be deleted, while disallowing the creation or committing of new/existing files.

total_modifies.description: Specifies the number of times this domain has been modified and the number of times the attributes for the domain have changed. A SmartLock domain can be modified a fixed number of times as defined by the 'max_modifies' parameter.

type.description: Specifies whether the domain is an enterprise domain or a compliance domain. Compliance domains can not be created on enterprise clusters. Enterprise and compliance domains can be created on compliance clusters.

resume.description: Provide this token as the 'resume' query argument to continue listing results.

worm_committed.description: Indicates whether the file was committed to the WORM state.

worm_override_retention_date.description: Provides the override retention date that is set on the SmartLock directory where the file resides.

worm_override_retention_date_val.description: Provides the override retention date in seconds from UNIX Epoch or UTC.

worm_retention_date.description: Provides the retention expiration date in Coordinated Universal Time (such as UTC/GMT).

worm_retention_date_val.description: Provides the retention expiration date in seconds from UNIX Epoch or UTC.

cdate.description: To set the compliance clock to the current system time, PUT to this resource with an empty JSON object {} for the cdate value.  This cluster must be in compliance mode to set the compliance clock.

Specifies the current time of the SmartLock compliance clock in Unix Epoch seconds. If the compliance clock is not set, this value is null. A PUT request will set the compliance clock date to the current system time. The cluster must be in compliance mode to set the compliance clock.

auth_providers.description: Specifies the list of authentication providers available on this access zone.

cache_entry_expiry.description: Specifies amount of time in seconds to cache a user/group.

create_path.description: Determines if a path is created when a path does not exist.

home_directory_umask.description: Specifies the permissions set on automatically created user home directories.

ifs_restricted.description: Specifies a list of users and groups that have read and write access to /ifs.

get.description: View pool usage information of a directory, classified by storage pools in response "usage_data". The storage pool type can be specified by query parameter "storage_pool_type". The directory is "path" query parameter. The response "dir_usage" is total disk usage of directory, over all pools at a given storage pool level. When path cannot be found within result, status code 404 and error message will be returned.
